headline: Rafael Nadal wins 14th Roland Garros title
summarized_story:
Spanish tennis legend, Rafael Nadal on Sunday, won a 14th French Open and record-extending 22nd Grand Slam title with a straight-sets rout of Casper Ruud to become the oldest male champion at Roland Garros.
The 36-year-old won 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 with victory coming 17 years to the day since he claimed his first French Open as a 19-year-old in 2005.
Nadal won the last 11 games of the final and is now two Slams ahead of rivals Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer with Sunday’s victory coming against all the odds.
He also needed the best part of a gruelling 12 hours to see off Felix Auger-Aliassime, Novak Djokovic and Alexander Zverev in the previous three rounds.

headline: Capital Market Participants To Get Unique Identifiers – SEC
summarized_story:

Director General of the SEC, Mr. Lamido Yuguda stated this during a meeting with the Management of Nigeria Data Protection Bureau in Abuja weekend.
Yuguda said the identity management project already on-going in the capital market is to ensure that every participant within the capital market has a unique identifier that will be given to them so all capital market transactions will be secured and done on a Straight Through Processing basis, leaving very little human intervention in the processing of data.
Looking at the capital market, people buy investments, remove money, get dividends etc., everything about it is data because no one wants to go to a stockbroker’s office now.
